name: Mount Adams

trails_config.name: Airline Trail (via Durand Ridge)
trails_config.description: A steep climb up the Airline Trail along Durand Ridge leading to expansive alpine views. This route gains the rocky summit above treeline, offering breathtaking panoramas of the Presidential Range.

trails_config.name: King Ravine Route
trails_config.description: A challenging route ascending through King Ravine’s jumbled boulders and extremely steep headwall. This expert loop climbs into an awe-inspiring glacial ravine and returns via the Airline, combining thrilling scrambles with safer descent.

current_conditions.ai_summary: A spectacular hike located in New Hampshire. Standing at 5793 feet, Mount Adams offers breathtaking views and a rewarding challenge for hikers of all levels.
risk_factors: Check local trail conditions before departing.
Start early to avoid afternoon storms.

generated_description:
The Experience

Standing at 5793 feet, Mount Adams is a standout peak in New Hampshire. Known for its rugged and challenging terrain, it offers a quintessential hiking experience.

The Challenge

Hikers often choose the **Airline Trail (via Durand Ridge)**, a **8.6 mile** route gaining significant elevation. As part of the **NH48 4000-Footers**, it draws peak-baggers from across the region.

Peak Bagging Logic

**Peak Bagging Opportunity:** Consider connecting this hike with **Mount Madison**, which is just 0.9 miles away. Linking these peaks is a popular way to maximize your day on the trail.
